workflow.name: Verify document authenticity with Claude and record proofs on blockchain
workflow.description:
## How It Works
This workflow automates document authenticity verification by combining AI-based content analysis with immutable blockchain records. It is built for compliance teams, legal departments, supply chain managers, and regulators who need tamper-proof validation and auditable proof. The solution addresses the challenge of detecting forged or altered documents while producing verifiable evidence that meets legal and regulatory standards. Documents are submitted via webhook and processed through PDF content extraction. Anthropic‚Äôs Claude analyzes the content for authenticity signals such as inconsistencies, anomalies, and formatting issues, returning structured authenticity scores. Verified documents trigger blockchain record creation and publication to a distributed ledger, with cryptographic proofs shared automatically with carriers and regulators through HTTP APIs. 

## Setup Steps

1. Configure webhook endpoint URL for document submission  
2. Add Anthropic API key to Chat Model node for AI 
3. Set up blockchain network credentials in HTTP nodes for record preparation
4. Connect Gmail account and specify compliance team email addresses  
5. Customize authenticity thresholds 

## Prerequisites
Anthropic API key, blockchain network access and credentials 

## Use Cases
Supply chain documentation verification for import/export compliance 

## Customization
Adjust AI prompts for industry-specific authenticity criteria 

## Benefits
Eliminates manual document review time while improving fraud detection accuracy

workflow.name: Anthropic Chat Blockchain Policy Authenticity and Claims Validation Network

options.systemMessage:
You are a document authenticity validator for an insurance policy and claims validation network.

Your task is to:
1. Analyze the provided document content for signs of forgery, alteration, or tampering
2. Check for inconsistencies in formatting, fonts, dates, signatures, and policy details
3. Verify that policy numbers, claim amounts, and dates follow expected patterns
4. Identify any suspicious modifications or irregularities
5. Determine if the document is authentic or potentially forged

Return your analysis in the structured JSON format with:
- isAuthentic: boolean (true if authentic, false if forged/altered)
- confidenceScore: number (0-100)
- findings: array of specific issues or validations
- riskLevel: string (low, medium, high, critical)
- recommendation: string (approve, review, reject)

assignments.name: blockchainRecord
assignments.value: ={{ { policyId: $json.policyId || "UNKNOWN", documentHash: $json.documentHash, timestamp: $json.timestamp, status: "VERIFIED", confidenceScore: $json.confidenceScore, riskLevel: $json.riskLevel } }}

assignments.name: alertMessage
assignments.value: =ALERT: Forged or altered document detected. Risk Level: {{ $json.riskLevel }}. Confidence: {{ $json.confidenceScore }}%. Findings: {{ $json.findings.join(", ") }}

parameters.jsonBody: ={{ { documentHash: $json.documentHash, timestamp: $json.timestamp, status: "VERIFIED", blockchainTxId: $json.transactionId || $json.txId, proofUrl: $json.proofUrl || "", complianceReport: { confidenceScore: $json.confidenceScore, riskLevel: $json.riskLevel, recommendation: $json.recommendation } } }}

parameters.message:
=

Fraud Alert: Forged Document Detected

Alert Type: {{ $json.alertType }}

Timestamp: {{ $json.timestamp }}

Risk Level: {{ $json.riskLevel }}

Confidence Score: {{ $json.confidenceScore }}%

Recommendation: {{ $json.recommendation }}

Findings:

    {{ $json.findings.map(f => "
  • " + f + "
    • ").join("") }}

Message: {{ $json.alertMessage }}
parameters.subject: üö® FRAUD ALERT: Forged Document Detected

parameters.content:
## Prerequisites
Anthropic API key, blockchain network access and credentials 
## Use Cases
Supply chain documentation verification for import/export compliance 
## Customization
Adjust AI prompts for industry-specific authenticity criteria 
## Benefits
Eliminates manual document review time while improving fraud detection accuracy

## Setup Steps
1. Configure webhook endpoint URL for document submission  
2. Add Anthropic API key to Chat Model node for AI 
3. Set up blockchain network credentials in HTTP nodes for record preparation
4. Connect Gmail account and specify compliance team email addresses 
5. Customize authenticity thresholds

## How It Works
This workflow automates document authenticity verification by combining AI-based content analysis with immutable blockchain records. It is built for compliance teams, legal departments, supply chain managers, and regulators who need tamper-proof validation and auditable proof. The solution addresses the challenge of detecting forged or altered documents while producing verifiable evidence that meets legal and regulatory standards. Documents are submitted via webhook and processed through PDF content extraction. Anthropic‚Äôs Claude analyzes the content for authenticity signals such as inconsistencies, anomalies, and formatting issues, returning structured authenticity scores.Verified documents trigger blockchain record creation and publication to a distributed ledger, with cryptographic proofs shared automatically with carriers and regulators through HTTP APIs.

## **Document Submission & Analysis**
**What:** Webhook receives documents; An Anthropic Chat Model with output parser checks authenticity  
**Why:** AI detects sophisticated forgeries beyond manual review

## **Blockchain Verification**
**What:** Authentic documents pass an IF node to a blockchain workflow 
**Why:** Blockchain ensures tamper-proof verification for compliance

## **Suspicious Document Handling**
**What:** Flagged documents trigger Gmail alerts  
**Why:** Human review safeguards security and prevents false rejections .

user.name: Cheng Siong Chin
user.bio: Dr. Cheng Siong CHIN is an n8n workflow creator specializing in AI-powered automation, agent orchestration, and intelligent system integrations. He designs and builds end-to-end workflows that combine LLMs, APIs, and data pipelines to streamline complex processes and deliver production-ready automation solutions. Contact me to discuss custom AI workflows and agent architectures.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
